question_text: Which of the following are valid characteristics of the M.2 interface? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: It can use either SATA or PCIe signaling
It physically supports both SSDs and RAM modules
It replaces the need for DIMM slots
It can be keyed differently to prevent insertion errors
correct_answer: It can use either SATA or PCIe signaling
It can be keyed differently to prevent insertion errors
explanation: M.2 is a flexible connector that supports both SATA and PCIe storage protocols. It uses physical keying to ensure compatibility and prevent misalignment.
